data.title: Pretty good
data.text: This is a small mom and pop place in town. The food was good and the service was excellent. I felt like it was pretty cheap also.

data.title: Our Downtown Favorite
data.text: A vintage cafe known as a 'favorite downtown hangout', - 'hangout' in its most positive sense. Friendly family run place. Best home-style cooking in town! Fine service. Frequently refilled coffee cups. Great freshly-baked cinnamon rolls  and home-style biscuits. Extensive traditional breakfast choices. Burger steak and eggs is very generous and filling. Try the outstanding home fries with it. Mexican specialties, too, such as the great breakfast enchiladas and fish tacos at lunch. The clam chowder is tops! Impressive civic participation awards. Annually named for best salsas and tamales in local competitions. Limited street parking in front. Very large lot in back convenient for rear entrance.  Very near downtown civic center, theaters, and special events frequently  held in plaza park.

data.title: Good food, good prices and excellent service!
data.text: If this were a bar it would be Cheers!  I have been coming here off and on for years and their food is good, prices are more than fair and the service is excellent!  The wait staff always treat you like family.  I highly recommend this establishment for lunch but get there early as it tends to fill up quickly.

data.title: awesome ma & pop sort of place
data.text: Old fashion diner, amazing food with something for everyone. Well priced. Never felt rushed here. ! The service is good too.

data.title: excellent service and great food
data.text: The service is fantastic, individuals are treated like family, waitresses are very friendly and helpful.  Food is like good home cooking, tasty and great helpings. Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Like going home
data.text: A family owned cafe that has been in business for over 50 years in Oxnard.  Everyone is very friendly and the food it good.  fresh coffee is poured with frequent warm ups/refills.  The price is very reasonable, did I say the food is very good?

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: This place is the bomb. I always love going there with my wife. I had the Biscuits and Gravy and Hash Browns and My wife had Huevos Rancheros which was absolutely delicious. I recommend this place to everyone.

data.title: Wonderful family-owned restaurant. Large portions and good value.
data.text: I live in Oxnard and I am a regular at BGs. It is a breakfast and lunch café. The portions are generous and the atmosphere is congenial

data.title: Fantastic breakfast spot!
data.text:
Chilaquiles and Eggs ($8.50) is crispy tortilla strips tossed with onion and tomato, topped with red salsa and cheese, served with sour cream and your choice of either home fries, hash browns, refried beans, sliced tomatoes, cottage cheese, or fresh fruit. It also comes with your choice of toast, English muffin, buttermilk biscuit, or tortillas. These are one of the best chilaquiles you'll ever have. Since they use their award-winning salsa, the tortilla strips absorb the flavors of the tomatoes, onions, and spices. It has a slightly spicy kick but is not overwhelming. The sour cream adds a creamy cooling quality to finish it off. Rating: 4.5/5

One Biscuit and Country Gravy ($3) is really a meal in itself. The homemade buttermilk biscuits are gigante! They are light and fluffy and you can tell that they are freshly baked that morning. The gravy has a great peppery sausage flavor with a creamy texture. Rating: 4.9/5

Avocado Eggs Benedict ($12) is two poached eggs on grilled English muffins with grilled tomatoes, two slices of ham, and topped with creamy hollandaise sauce and sliced avocado. The creamy hollandaise works excellently with the buttery avocado. The thick-sliced ham adds a meaty texture and saltiness to the dish. The perfectly poached eggs have flowing liquid gold yolks and the tomato adds a hint of sweetness. Rating: 4.5/5

Chile Verde Omelet (look for this as a special) is beautifully made with tender pork chunks in a slight spicy chile verde sauce. The cheese is gooey inside and also melted on top. It is a wonderful fusion of an American style omelet with Mexican flavors. Rating: 4.4/5

data.title: Down Home Food
data.text: Only wish they were open for dinner!  Busy place, local breakfast spot, great lunches too.  Not open late so get there with time to enjoy.

data.title: Nice breakfast
data.text: The Huevos Rancheros at this place are quite good indeed. This place has got the air of a small town restaurant, complete with the regulars and staff that seem to know them by first name. Great little place and quite friendly staff I'll tell you. If you need quick breakfast then head here, it works.

data.title: good customer service
data.text: food dervice great food bill was very reasonable i was wihfamily and not in a good m00d but by thr tir i lrft it was all different

data.title: Great breakfast!
data.text: Good food and plenty of it at great prices. Great service too.Right in downtown Oxnard where you get a flavor of the original city.

data.title: Not as good as it use to be
data.text: Use to be a regular, but not any longer. Food orders 80% of the time not prepared as requested.  Have been served bread with mold and their response was not a big deal. Noticed that uncooked eggs are stored in an unrefrigerated area. I have moved on to a different place.

data.title: Good, down home cookin
data.text: We have only had breakfast here. The staff is pleasant as they greet you.  I love a restaurant that when I walk in the food aromas fill the air.  My eggs have been perfect.  My husband orders a Mexican breakfast and has been pleased with all his choices.  They are a little too spicy for me.  The restaurant is adorned with colorful paintings and is festive.  We will go back again.

data.title: Friends and Family
data.text: This place has been open for at least 50 year and still maintains that family atmosphere,  you walk in and there greet and treat you like family.  The food is prepared well and is tasty.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  It is always clean and attractive.  It is like taking a step back in time.  You stop in to relax and slow down your pace.

data.title: Order the cheesesteak omelette!!!
data.text:
A somewhat regular here....probably at least monthly. Staff knows what I like and
that helps me return w/o hesitation..... Cheesesteak omelette rocks!!! Have them cook it well done....oh so good!!!

data.title: Good food and good prices!
data.text: Good food and good prices. Seems to be the place to come for breakfast especially. Always good service and consistently good food.

data.title: Oxnard Breakfast
data.text: Best selection of American and Mexican breakfast meals ever. We had the chorizzo hash and eggs, and a first with the nopalitos. That's cactus diced up in the omelette. Great food!

data.title: Local cafe
data.text: Much larger menu selection that few years back.  I thoroughly enjoyed the food.  As you can see from the photo here, the food is quite upscale.  I do feel they could get newer booths, etc.
